item.title: R Style Guide
item.description: This is mainly a note to self: There are several style guides for R out there. I particularly like the one from GoogleÂ and the somewhat lighter version of Hadley (ggplot god). All of that style guide thinking started after a question on Â about R workflow … How do we organize large R projects. Hadley (again) is favoring an Load-Clean-Func-Do approach which looks somewhat like that: load.R # load data clean.

item.title: Religion and # of babies …
item.description: Religion seems to have little influence on the # of babies per woman – who might have thought … Here is another excellent talk of Hans RÃ¶sling on the topic.

item.title: awesome visualization tool for R
item.description: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/googleVis/ enables chart generation similar to the ones instroduced by Hans RoeslingÂ in his TED talkÂ on poverty – extremly cool ðŸ™‚
